intro: Psychotria diffusa var. cervina, commonly known as the "Cape gooseberry" or "physostegia," is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, egg-shaped berries that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. The plant features opposite, elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy texture and produces small, white to pale green flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The berries are edible when ripe but can be toxic if consumed unripe or in large quantities.
